com.example.colibris.ui

Class WiFiServiceDiscoveryActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.example.colibris.ui.WiFiServiceDiscoveryActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.net.wifi.p2p.WifiP2pManager.ConnectionInfoListener, android.os.Handler.Callback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, SleepListener, WifiDirectCalibrationFragment.MessageTarget

    public class WiFiServiceDiscoveryActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.os.Handler.Callback, WifiDirectCalibrationFragment.MessageTarget, SleepListener, android.net.wifi.p2p.WifiP2pManager.ConnectionInfoListener
    This activity registers a local (calibration) service and perform discovery over Wi-Fi p2p network. It also hosts a couple of fragments to manage calibration operations. When the app is launched, the device publishes a calibration service and also tries to discover services published by other peers. On selecting a peer published service, the app initiates a Wi-Fi P2P (Direct) connection with the peer. On successful connection with a peer advertising the same service, the app opens up sockets to initiate a calibration process. this fragment is then added to the the main activity which manages the interface and messaging needs for a session.
